RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BROWN SUGA BABE took the lead at the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge off the rail on the turn, dueled clear mid-stretch and held well under steady handling. YOU CAN'T WIN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail then angled to the outside toward the head of the lane and steadily closed to take second the final strides. P B FOXY chased inside, raced close at the rail on the turn but flattened the final sixteenth. HONEY PLEASE chased and raced close in the four path on the turn, but flattened inside the eighth pole. HONKEY TONK TIME took a brief early lead then gave chase from the three eighths pole, continued close through the turn but weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Brown Suga Babe
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge off rail turn,clear 1/16,driving

ENTRY.NAME: Honkey Tonk Time
ENTRY.OWNER: Melton Christopher W and Coffey Roy

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $1 5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TEACHINTHERELEASE took a quick lead and tapered to the inside to show the way, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, widened at the rail on the turn and was kept alert through the stretch. HARDLY EVER BETTER chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and finished evenly while settling for second. MAKIN' GOLD chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and came along for third later yards. TURTLE DOVE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the stretch. REATA'S CASTLE gave chase while saving ground. JUBA BOUND chased the early pace outside, raced in the three path on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Turtle Dove
ENTRY.OWNER: CM Racing and Jones Jr Michael E

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNION LEAGUE broke outward then saved ground, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, dug in for the lead nearing mid-stretch, edged briefly clear then held on. MISS YOU AJAX was shuffled back at the start then saved ground, bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in leaving the turn and took second the final strides while gaining on the winner. CAJUN FUN took the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, was met mid-stretch then flattened later yards. COUNTRY CHARLIE stalked off the rail, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and flattened in the stretch. PLAYBOY ROY rounded the opening turn about the three path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and could only close the gap in the lane. DANNY'S WINKSTER settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and weakened leaving the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Union League
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 7/16,rail far turn,up near 1/16,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.OWNER: Holly Ridge Farm, LLC and Collins, Timothy

ENTRY.NAME: Country Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15 ,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S HAT TRICK stalked off the rail on the opening turn then challenged at even terms into the backstretch, dueled for the lead two deep approaching the quarter pole, raced clear midway on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. PAYMENGOLD saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and entered the far turn near the rail, angled to the six path through the turn and came along to take second later yards. LORD OF CORK took the lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met at the half mile pole and kept the edge over Juba's Hat Trick from that point, but succumbed to the pressure approaching the quarter pole, dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and flattened in the lane. MARCHED raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. MINISTRY OF MAGIC settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the six path and showed little more. BOSS E BOOGS rated close off the rail, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole then weakened leaving the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Boss E Boogs
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 3/8,weakened into lane

ENTRY.NAME: Lord of Cork
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met 1/2,kept edge,caught near 1/4,flatten lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SCHMEAR rounded the opening turn in the four path, closed to the front passing the three eighths pole, dueled clear midway on the far turn, was steadily handled to late stretch then taken in hand approaching the wire. ROYAL AIR FORCE stalked off the rail, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced close through the backstretch, but dropped back midway on the far turn and had to settle for second best. GLOBALIZATION was reluctant in the post parade then rounded the opening turn about the four path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and dueled for third. SMOKIN SMITTY rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole but was caught past the pole, flattened at the rail into the far turn and was outfinished for third. GAMING SOUL rounded the first turn about the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little more. TAKE AIM saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch but weakened at the rail on the far turn. WAVE ACTION was not a factor. PAY THE SQUID saved ground close to the early pace then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Air Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,dropped back mid turn,settled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Schmear
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,bid 7/16,up past 3/8,clear mid turn,in hand late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE ILLUSIONIST pressured the pace and took the lead two deep past the quarter pole, dueled clear midway on the turn and was kept alert in the lane. FROGGY THE GREMLIN gave chase through the backstretch, entered the turn about the three path, drifted toward the head of the lane and finished evenly to take second later yards. PRIMETIME JET set a pressured pace inside, was met past the quarter pole, dropped back at the rail midway on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. HUEY DUEY steadied at the start then gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path and flattened in the lane. RUNAWAY ROAD gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. THUNDERINREADYRICK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. FIFTY FIFTY came away awkwardly then gave chase outside, but weakened past the five sixteenths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Primetime Jet
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met past 1/4,dropped back mid turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: The Illusionist
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up 2d past 1/4,clear mid turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considere d In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FANCY HER UP took an immediate lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure passing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled to hold on well. BELLA MELA gave chase through the backstretch, entered the turn about the three path, drifted toward the head of the lane, cleared second inside the sixteenth pole and finished well. SENTELLA gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. EMBERLY gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four and five paths on the turn, left the turn outside and passed some rivals. SNOWY JUBA CAT chased, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened. CASTLE TOY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path then flattened stride. TATOR MADE gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING OF LUCK gave chase through the backstretch, angled to the rail into the turn, took the lead approaching the head of the lane, raced clear from the eighth pole and was steadily handled in the lane. ROAD PUNCH pressured the pace through the backstretch, was met toward the head of the lane, drifted leaving the turn and settled for second. J. WICK pressured the pace through the backstretch but dropped back approaching the quarter pole, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened the final sixteenth. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE gave chase, raced in the five path on the turn and showed little in the lane. DOG TOWN ALLEN set a pressured pace outside, raced four wide through the turn, gave up the lead nearing the head of the lane, drifted leaving the turn and weakened. TO THE TOP gave chase to no avail. BOO TOO chased inside but steadied at the rail nearing the five sixteenths pole and weakened on the turn. IRISH FIRE gave chase and saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Punch
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Jay

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
